alert.note: Alert for Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 17 at 3:36AM EDT until August 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT....High risk of rip currents. * WHERE...In Maryland, the Atlantic facing beaches of Worchester County including Ocean City and Assateague. In North Carolina, the Atlantic facing beaches of the Northern Outer Banks. In Virginia, the Atlantic facing beaches of the city of Virginia Beach, and Accomack and Northampton Counties. * WHEN...From 8 AM EDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 3 to 4 ft will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents.
info.instruction: A Beach Hazards Statement is issued when threats such as rip currents...longshore currents...sneaker waves and other hazards create life-threatening conditions in the surf zone. Caution should be used when in or near the water.
